As Ruth Wightman, she had written scripts for Hollywood films and trained as a bullfighter in Spain. In her youth she had been raped by the American novelist Jack London. Her husband, Gouverneur Morris, was a well-known novelist and ...

Source: Fathers and Sons: The Autobiography of a Family - Page 189

comment.author: 36899742@N00
comment._content: "General" Charles T. Kelly led a western contingent of Coxey's Army, which was a march of unemployed men on Washington to seek federal assistance during the panic of 1894. Jack London joined the army and wrote about it in carl-bell-2.baylor.edu/~bellc/JL/TheMarchOfKellysArmy.html. Kelly attempted to lead his own march on Washington in 1914 but was arrested and gave it up. You can see a shot of the army in the next photo, which appears to be the top part of this one.
